title: Upgrade Dependencies - the second part
body_html:
I'm taking 1 dependency after another :)
This removes the version lock on Feedjira. The main problem is that feedjira switched from curb to faradayas HTTP framework and therefor does not support file:// URL's anymore.
My workaround is to server the local files over HTTP via a small webrick server. This allows us to upgrade Feedjira and still maintain the same test coverage.

I also included a regular bundle upgrade which upgraded the AWS gem, but this is safe since we switched to the 2.x version.

Let me know what you think about that approach.

Thanks
Ben

body:
I'm taking 1 dependency after another :)
This removes the version lock on Feedjira. The main problem is that feedjira switched from `curb` to `faraday`as HTTP framework and therefor does not support `file://` URL's anymore.
My workaround is to server the local files over HTTP via a small webrick server. This allows us to upgrade Feedjira and still maintain the same test coverage. 

I also included a regular `bundle upgrade` which upgraded the AWS gem, but this is safe since we switched to the `2.x` version.

Let me know what you think about that approach.

Thanks
Ben
